intro: Pedicularis nasuta, commonly known as the noble monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its unique floral structure attracts pollinators such as bees and flies, playing a role in its reproductive success. Pedicularis nasuta is often found in open meadows and slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
